questions.question: Q1.The ring compression test is used to test:

answers.a: Friction condition of the billet and dies
answers.b: The temperature variation in the billet

explanations.a: Correct — The ring compression test is primarily used to determine friction between billet and dies.
explanations.b: Temperature variation is not measured in this test.
explanations.c: Surface hardness is not evaluated using RCT.

questions.question: Q2.The material used in the ring compression test is:

explanations.a: Incorrect — RCT requires a ring, not a solid cylinder.
explanations.b: Correct — RCT uses a hollow ring specimen (OD–ID–Height).
explanations.c: Incorrect — Square plates are not used.

answers.a: Uniform increase of the internal and external diameter of the specimen
answers.b: Decrease in external diameter and increase in internal diameter
answers.c: Increase in external diameter and reduction in inner diameter

explanations.b: Correct — With good lubrication (low friction), ID increases while OD also increases.
explanations.c: Incorrect — Reduction in ID occurs in high friction.

questions.question: Q4.In the virtual simulation video of the ring compression test, the specimen height is reduced to:

explanations.a: Correct — The standard RCT reduces height to 50%.
explanations.b: 75% reduction is not shown in the video.
explanations.c: Incorrect — Only 50% is used in standard simulation.

questions.question: Q5.In the simulation bench of the ring compression test, the material not used for the testing is:

explanations.d: Correct — All three materials are used, so 'not used' = none, hence all options are included.
